column4: i have a cd that is for window$ that i need to run under linux... (no more M$ on this comp) any ideas? (practice tests for my class)
wine maybe, take a look at the contents and see how the tests are stored
ill check that out ty
what version of python2.4 is installed now?
would the cmd to get wine be 'sudo apt-get install wine'?
yes, that would be one way
i am trying to use wine to install and run this cd, but it gives me an error when it trys to inst... am i doing something wrond?
i have installed wine using the SPM...  what would be the next step in using it to view/install my window$ based cd?
no idea, I've never used wine.  All I know is you do 'wine file.exe' and pray it works
if it is on cd, would the file be under '~/Desktop/*cdname*/filename.exe?
/media/cdrom0/filename.exe usually, try going in a terminal and navigating to the cd
someone was saying earlier that nautilus lets you double click on exe's if you have installed wine, you can try that too
ha
for the program i am trying to install, its asking 'install to'...  would that be like /media/hda1/*?
is this for wine?
the default is C:\blah blah blah
ya....  i know you dont know about wine, but is that where you would install anything to your hd?
?  that's a bin file
keep adding v's aptitude -v -v moo
you can play star wars in OOo calc
works for me...
